uno.cards
Class Deck

java.lang.Object
  uno.cards.Deck
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<UNO_Card>
public class Deck
extends Object
implements Iterable<UNO_Card>

Deck provides a standard deck of 108 UNO cards. The deck is initially shuffled, but may be reshuffled at any time. Functionality for the deck is provided as follows:

  • shuffle() : shuffle the deck.
  • dealCard() : deals the top card from the deck. The card is removed from the deck.
  • iterator() : returns an iterator over the deck that returns UNO Cards.

The cards in the deck may also be processed using a for-each loop. For example, the cards in the deck can be printed as follows:


  Deck deck = new Deck(); // creates a shuffled deck
  for(UNO_Card card: deck)
     System.out.print(card);

The load Deck method generates a deck of 108 UNO cards. The number of cards is as follows:

  • 4 zeros one each of RED, BLUE, GREEN and YELLOW
  • 2 of each of the other face cards (1 - 9) for each color RED, BLUE, GREEN, YELLOW
  • 2 each of the action cards DRAW 2, SKIP, and REVERSE in each of the colors RED, BLUE, GREEN, YELLOW
  • 4 WILD cards
  • 4 WILD DRAW 4 cards

Constructor Detail

Deck

public Deck()
Constructs a new shuffled deck of 108 UNO_Cards.

Method Detail

addCard

public void addCard(UNO_Card card)
This method allows a card to be added to the top of the UNO Deck. It is intended to be used after one or more cards have been removed from the deck and one needs to be returned. For instance, in an UNO game after the cards are dealt to players, the deck typically becomes the discard pile. This method allows discarded cards to be returned to the deck.

Parameters:
card - The card to return to the deck.

dealCard

public UNO_Card dealCard()
This method deals one card from the top of the deck. The card is reomved from the deck and returned by the method.

Returns:
The top card on the deck.

iterator

public Iterator<UNO_Card> iterator()
This method returns an iterator over UNO_Cards that may be used to iterate over the Deck of cards. Think of this as thumbing through the cards.

Specified by:
iterator in interface Iterable<UNO_Card>
Returns:
An iterator over the deck of UNO_Cards.

numberOfCards

public int numberOfCards()
This method returns the number of cards in the Deck.

Returns:
The number of cards in the Deck.

shuffle

public void shuffle()
This method uses the Fischer-Yates algorithm to shuffle the UNO Deck.

See Also:
Fischer-Yates Shuffle
